Message.Title: IMO Company Needs To Issue Shares-At Least $300 million
Message.Msg: Rarely does issuing shares increase earnings per share but in this case I believe it does. They are hamstrung by the leverage ratio, both at the bank and the holding company, so much so that they had to move 8 billion in potential interest earning assets off the balance sheet. Increasing equity by 300 million should allow them to move approximately 3 billion of that cash back to the company. If it just earns 2% it would create approximately 60 million of additional interest income before taxes, approximately 40 million after taxes and if my math is correct this move would be earnings per share accretive. It also would give them flexibility to make some other moves that may have been prevented by their leverage ratio situation, like taking a loss on paying back the fed borrowings of over 6 billion on which they are incurring 200 million in annual interest expense. I wonder if maybe they were floating this possibility and Ken G. wanted to get out before it happened.

Topic.Title: IMO Company Needs To Issue Shares-At Least $300 million

Message.Msg: Screw that, we've had all the dilution we need considering the cost of money today. Yes, if Interest rates were higher I'd accept the dilution, but for now they're not and we've already taken all the dilution we can in the short term (last few years)

Topic.Title: IMO Company Needs To Issue Shares-At Least $300 million

Message.Msg: I suggest you do the math and see just how hamstrung they are because of the leverage ratio issue. It will get worse if they can't use the TRUPS in their equity calculation. They won't be able to do much of anything capital wise for a decent amount of time if the CFO was correct when he said provisions will stay in the 50 million per quarter range for the balance of the year. This move should add $50 million a year to their equity number due to the increased earnings and the ability to use more of their DTA. Also, my math may be incorrect as I said but this isn't dilutive to earnings per share, it's accretive.
**all you ever do is make predictions that never come through** Lets be honest, did your health premiums rise after the President said they would not?.... It's a simple yes or no question.

Topic.Title: We named the airport in our national capital for a man who sold weapons stolen from Pentagon warehouses to Ayatollah Khomeini

Message.Msg: " Reagan aided saddam and the Ayatolloh, and both were on the terrorist list. And neither were a threat to the USA." How can they be on terrorist list and not being a threat? Can you make some coherent point? Or just farting white noise to let everyone know ducky didn't go away from this MB? Soviet Union was US ally during the WWII. Yet, Soviet Union remained major threat to this country for many decades after. Does that mean FDR should never make deals with Soviets to defeat #$%$ Germany? Help to Saddam was limited by weaponry and intelligence needed to fight Iranians. US didn't help Saddam building his nuclear reactor. France did. And if it wouldn't be for Israels' "meddling" in 1981 Saddam would be sitting on nukes today. Would that be wonderful! US military aid to Saddam was strategic move to fight a bigger threat at the time. We acted accordingly to our best interests. Now, what's meddling? Afghanistan was meddling. I guess, 3000 Americans murdered on our soil is not an act of war? Obama didn't want to meddle with Iran in early 2009 when mullahs were doing carnage on the streets after elections. But helping Libyan rebels to overthrow Qaddafi wasn't meddling? Last year he said that using chemical weapons in Syria would be a "game change". If he will take action(big IF), will that be meddling? Look, I am getting confused with this word. Can we even loudly condemn actions of foreign governments or it's going to be interpreted as meddling? Would you be kind to give a proper definition for the word that wouldn't make you a hypocrite?
